column2: but my family has mustered enough [religious_leader.GetFaith.GetAdjective] lands and spiritual authority to be able to invoke a conclave of our highest clerics. Finally our blood

iberia_north_africa.0102.desc.intro0:"After a lifetime of accruing religious and political authority
column2: [religious_leader.GetTitledFirstName] has managed to gather a great conclave of [religious_leader.GetFaith.GetAdjective] ministers at [religious_leader.GetHerHis] capital of [religious_leader.GetCapitalLocation.GetTitle.GetBaseNameNoTier] to discuss the future of the faith.\n\nAfter weeks of blistering debate
column3: the assembled clergy have elected to reaffirm their loyalty to [pope.GetTitledFirstName]
column4: albeit with some... #EMP tweaks#! to ecclesiastic policy.\n\nThese ameliorations focus chiefly on"

column2: and how such can only be prevented by establishing temporal power through every means available."
ensuring religious homogeneity between the major cultures subscribing to the Church."

column1: iberia_north_africa.0102.desc.pluralist0:"establishing rigorous customs and practices for the studying of the [religious_leader.GetFaith.ReligiousText]
column2: and formal methods to challenge the understanding of such."

column1: iberia_north_africa.0102.a.same_religion0:"Do they define #EMP us#! as a threat?"
iberia_north_africa.0102.b.misc0:"As long as they keep to themselves."
iberia_north_africa.0102.c.same_religion0:"How pointless; to study so hard when already so wrong..."
iberia_north_africa.0102.c.misc0:"Their solution to doctrinal drift is to nitpick doctrine?"
iberia_north_africa.0111.t0:"Freedom from the Shackles of Rome"
iberia_north_africa.0111.desc0:"It's taken years to build the political and spiritual unity to muster this conclave
column2: but I've finally brought enough of both the peasantry and the clergy to my banners to meaningfully repudiate the false-[pope.GetTitledFirstName].\n\nEven now
column3: the passageways and guest rooms of [religious_leader.GetCapitalLocation.GetTitle.GetBaseNameNoTier] throng with argumentative clerics and impassioned bishops; every aggrieved friar and petty [religious_leader.GetFaith.PriestNeuter] that Rome has ever snubbed clogging my halls.\n\nAll this debate is crucial for legitimacy
column4: but ultimately
column6: #EMP my#! word shall be the final deciding vote."

column1: iberia_north_africa.0111.a0:"The Son of God taught peace
column2: and we shall follow."
we know the value of defending our own!"

column1: iberia_north_africa.0111.c0:"Is Islam not a religion of the Book too?"

column2: [religious_leader.GetTitledFirstName] has at last achieved [religious_leader.GetHerHis] life's work of accruing enough political and spiritual authority to bring the [religious_leader.GetFaith.GetAdjective] Church together in pursuit of one goal: breaking with the dictats of [pope.GetTitledFirstName].\n\nThe accompanying church council has been explosive in its discussion about how to fill the void left by Rome's grasp
column3: with some clerics reported openly brawling in the halls of [religious_leader.GetCapitalLocation.GetTitle.GetBaseNameNoTier].\n\n[religious_leader.GetTitledFirstNamePossessiveNoTooltip] intercession is the only thing that's broken the deadlock
column4: electing to focus on"

column2: [religious_leader.GetFaith.GetAdherentNamePluralNoTooltip] should focus on the piety of simply living a good life rather than trying to pave the road to [religious_leader.GetFaith.PositiveAfterLife] with the blood of infidels."

column2: championing an ecumenical approach to interfaith relations."
